intro: Allantodia nitidula, commonly known as the smooth allantodia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
